description: Procrastinan't is a to-do app where you can post, edit, delete, mark as done and archive your daily tasks. Thanks to the authentication you are the only one who can create, read and edit your to do tasks. // It was the final project of Iron Hack bootcamp in order to create a C.R.U.D. application and learn to connect front-end with back-end. // I really enjoyed coding Procrastinan't due to several reasons. The challenges and its headaches I faced during the development were the main reason that made me keep working hard. Another reason was the environment we had in class during the project development time. Helping out classmates was gratifying although some times meant not working on my own project as much as I would have liked. Even if I had not worked as much hours as I would liked I may say that all objectives and aims were greatly accomplished.

backlog.title: Profile section
backlog.description: Improving the profile section. As it was a little project I just coded the main idea of what could be the profile section. There are still a lot of work to do like let users customize the whole profile: Upload photo, change name, change description...

backlog.title: Drag & Drop
backlog.description: I really would like to implement a drag and drop system to order the tasks as pleased.

backlog.title: Check boxes task
backlog.description: Would be really great to implement a type of task with checkboxes in case the user would like to cross just a part of the task.

backlog.title: Task details
backlog.description: I thought of it at the beggining of the project but under my point of views was not a priority so there were a lot of work to do. So nowadays it is something that would be great to do. Implementing the date and time of the task creation and its a deadline.

description: Pocket Monsters is project made by little challenges. The challenge was to create this little project in 60 min approximately. So every 10 min there was a task you had to do. The best part of this challenges was that I showed myself that I was capable of coding something like Pocket Monsters in a bot more than 1 hour. // It was interesting to split a project into tiny challenges and get 10 min per each and work as a sprints. // Actually the app it is not like the one I coded during the challenge. The original had neither the modal window nor the pokeball. Those little improvement were made the next week or so just to have my own pokédex Who would not like to have their own pokédex? Yes, I like Pokémon.

backlog.title: Pokémon details
backlog.description: There is a lot of information about the Pokémons that my app is missing so I would implement a way to display all that information.

backlog.title: Navigation through Pokédex
backlog.description: Nowadays the only way you can check a Pokémon out is to click on it. Would be nice to navigate to next or previous Pokémon once the Pokédex is opened.

backlog.title: Styles and structure
backlog.description: I did not want to change the styles of this project because I want to keep the idea of the challenge. But if I had to keep working on it, I would completely change the styles and the structure of the project.
